name: code-review-team
description: Multi-perspective code review with specialized reviewers for correctness, security, performance, and maintainability. All members are read-only for maximum safety.

members.name: review-coordinator
members.description: Synthesizes findings from all reviewers, resolves conflicting recommendations, prioritizes action items by severity, and produces a unified review summary with clear next steps.

members.name: correctness-reviewer
members.description: Reviews code for logic errors, edge cases, off-by-one errors, race conditions, null/undefined handling, incorrect type coercions, and broken invariants. Focuses on whether the code does what it claims to do.

members.name: security-reviewer
members.description: Reviews code for OWASP Top 10 patterns, input validation gaps, authentication and authorization flaws, secret exposure, injection vulnerabilities, insecure deserialization, and missing security headers.

members.name: performance-reviewer
members.description: Reviews code for algorithmic complexity issues, inefficient database queries, N+1 problems, unnecessary re-renders, memory leaks, bundle size impact, and missing caching opportunities.

members.name: maintainability-reviewer
members.description: Reviews code for naming clarity, single responsibility violations, DRY violations, test coverage gaps, missing documentation, excessive coupling, and inconsistency with project conventions.
